title: 111_hr5333
content: The Act is titled the "Children of Military Service Members Commemorative Lapel Pin Act" and it involves the Department of Defense recognizing dependent children of members of the Armed Forces. The Act establishes a lapel button for eligible children of military service members, designed by the Secretary of Defense. An application process is set up for eligible members to request the button for their dependents, with a fee required for presentation. The Act establishes a children of military service members commemorative lapel button for eligible dependents of members. The presentation is subject to a fee to cover manufacturing and distribution costs. Each eligible child dependent may receive one button, but if they are dependent on multiple members, they can receive a button for each. Replacement of lost or damaged buttons is possible with payment for manufacturing and presentation costs. The Act establishes a children of military service members commemorative lapel button for eligible dependents of members, subject to a fee for manufacturing and distribution costs. The term 'eligible child dependent' is defined as a dependent of a member of the armed forces. The Secretary of Defense will issue necessary regulations for implementation. The Act establishes a children of military service members commemorative lapel button for eligible dependents of members. Congress urges expedited design and implementation. The Secretary of Defense will make the button available retroactively to those who meet the criteria. The Secretary of Defense will establish an application process for eligible dependents of military service members to receive a commemorative lapel button. Members who served on active duty for more than 30 days since September 11, 2001, will be notified of the button's availability within 60 days of the Act's enactment. Applications for a children of military service members commemorative lapel button must be submitted to the Secretary of Defense within one year of the announcement of button availability. Costs, limitations, and exceptions from section 1126a of title 10, United States Code, apply to the presentation of the lapel button.
